snippet: A day after being removed from office, Yingluck Shinawatra’s legal troubles continued as a commission recommended that she be impeached.
abstract: Election Commission in Thailand casts doubt on voting tentatively set for July as proceedings to impeach ousted Prime Min Yingluck Schinawatra take another step forward; Yingluck, who allegedly transferred a civil servant illegally to another post, has also been connected to a farm subsidy program, process that could result in her being banned from politics.
lead_paragraph: A day after being removed from office, Yingluck Shinawatra’s legal troubles continued as a commission recommended that she be impeached.

headline.main: Ousted Thai Premier Faces Impeachment Amid Rising Tension
headline.print_headline: Thailand: Impeachment Proceedings Put July Election in Doubt
